channel.title: News digest (Danas + BBC)
channel.description: Automatski digest vesti (sirova verzija, bez AI)

item.title: BBC News app
item.description: [BBC News] Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

item.title: Can the Gaza ceasefire deal survive?
item.description: [BBC News] Its prospects depend heavily on the continuing engagement of the Trump White House, writes Frank Gardner.

item.title: Woman saved after slipping while boarding a moving train
item.description: [BBC News] Video released by India’s Southern Railways shows the moment a woman nearly fell in between a moving train and a station platform.

item.title: Trump imitates India's PM Narendra Modi in South Korea
item.description: [BBC News] Trump impersonated Modi while recalling his conversations from the May India-Pakistan conflict

item.title: Budget 2025: Key points at a glance
item.description: [BBC News] Changes to tax, pensions and welfare - here’s what you need to know from Rachel Reevesher second Budget.

item.title: Australia's beloved weather website got a makeover - and infuriated users
item.description: [BBC News] Nicknamed the Bom, the country's weather agency has been heavily criticised over a recent redesign.

item.title: Faisal Islam: The real reason Reeves is making you pay more tax
item.description: [BBC News] This is about buying breathing space, politically and economically. The two factors are now inseparable.

item.title: How the chancellor just took a chunk out of your future pay
item.description: [BBC News] The point at which you start to pay tax, and the point where you tip into paying a higher rate of tax have been frozen for three more years.

item.title: When Jonathan Bailey asks, the BBC listeners deliver...
item.description: [BBC News] Tom Service talks to Wicked: For Good star Jonathan Bailey, about a clarinet piece he learned as a kid.

item.title: Isas, cars and pensions: How the Budget affects you
item.description: [BBC News] The Budget delivered by Chancellor Rachel Reeves will affect you and your finances. Here's how.

item.title: Nvidia plays down Google chip threat concerns
item.description: [BBC News] The world's most valuable company said it was still "a generation ahead of the industry".

item.title: Jason Bateman: Voice acting is like 'performing blindfolded'
item.description: [BBC News] The actor speaks to the One Show about recording the voice for Nick Wilde in Zootropolis 2.

item.title: The film exploring myths about left-handed people
item.description: [BBC Culture] For centuries left-handedness was seen as "wrong"

item.title: India suffer heaviest defeat as SA complete series sweep
item.description: [BBC News] South Africa hand India their heaviest defeat by runs to complete a compelling 2-0 series sweep in Guwahati on Wednesday.

item.title: Israel confirms Hamas and PIJ returned body of Gaza hostage Dror Or
item.description: [BBC News] The handover means the bodies of two deceased hostages are still being held in Gaza six weeks after the ceasefire began.

item.title: 'We are still struggling after last year's Budget'
item.description: [BBC News] People in Thurrock say how Budget 2024 affected them - and their hopes for this year's announcement.

item.title: The story of Britain’s biggest mass poisoning
item.description: [BBC News] When tap water turns toxic in Cornwall, a public health disaster leads to accusations of a cover-up

item.title: Russian mercenaries accused of cold-blooded killings in Mali - BBC speaks to eyewitnesses
item.description: [BBC News] Refugees have given the BBC a harrowing account of atrocities committed by the Russian paramilitary force.

item.title: Who killed our children? Noida parents ask as 'house of horrors' convict acquitted
item.description: [BBC News] Twenty years after police found the bodies of 19 women and children in Nithari, the case is back in the spotlight.

item.title: Tyson hails Congolese roots on Rumble in the Jungle visit
item.description: [BBC News] Mike Tyson was a hit with boxing fans in Kinshasa after embracing his African roots as part of ongoing celebrations for the iconic Rumble in the Jungle.

item.title: The £5.30 orange juice that tells the story of why supermarket prices are sky high
item.description: [BBC News] Butter, chocolate, coffee and milk have all seen prices rocket. Tracing back through the story of one particular supermarket staple begins to explain why

item.title: Instagram to start closing Australian teen accounts ahead of social media ban
item.description: [BBC News] Under-sixteens will be banned from major social media plaforms from 10 December.

item.title: 'We did it!': Countries celebrate World Cup qualification
item.description: [BBC News] Panama, Haiti, Curacao and Scotland fans partied as their countries secured a spot at the World Cup in 2026.

item.title: The contradiction at the heart of the trillion-dollar AI race
item.description: [BBC News] The confusing question lingering over the AI hype is whether it could be a bubble at risk of bursting

item.title: Family of Indian man lynched over beef rumours vows to keep fighting for justice
item.description: [BBC News] Mohammad Akhlaq was lynched to death in 2015 over rumours that he had eaten beef.

item.title: MP's aide reported suspected China LinkedIn approach
item.description: [BBC News] Despite the government's efforts to thaw tensions with Beijing, MPs were warned this week of spying threats from China.

item.title: Roblox blocks children from chatting to adult strangers
item.description: [BBC News] One of the world's most popular gaming platforms has faced criticism for its child safety record.

item.title: On the front line of Europe's standoff with Russia's sanction-busting shadow fleet
item.description: [BBC News] With Europe imposing sanctions on Moscow, there has been a growing network of vessels sailing without a valid flag from Russia through European waters.

item.title: Why Bihar continues to struggle with illegal alcohol sales
item.description: [BBC News] Efforts to crack down on bootlegging continue nine years after prohibition was introduced in Bihar.

item.title: Watch: Freed detainee finds family alive after thinking they had been killed
item.description: [BBC News] Shadi Abu Sido told the BBC an Israeli prison officer said his family had been killed.

item.title: 'His aura is amazing' - Iwobi on Aubameyang
item.description: [BBC News] Speaking before Nigeria face Gabon in African play-offs for the World Cup, Alex Iwobi says Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was his "big brother" at Arsenal.

item.title: Russia's AI robot falls seconds after being unveiled
item.description: [BBC News] Footage shows the moment Russia's first anthropomorphic robot fell just seconds after its debut

item.title: Watch: Australian windsurfer escapes shark attack
item.description: [BBC News] Andy McDonald recalls moment he encountered a shark while windsurfing in Western Australia this week.

item.title: Protesters clash with security at COP30 climate talks in Brazil
item.description: [BBC News] Demonstrators, some wearing traditional indigenous dress, broke through security lines of the UN climate summit.

item.title: Israel has destroyed more than 1,500 buildings in Gaza since ceasefire
item.description: [BBC News] Entire neighbourhoods controlled by Israel have been levelled in less than a month, the images show.

item.title: Queues and protests: BBC at the Shein store opening in Paris
item.description: [BBC News] The online shopping giant opened its first physical shop in the world - in a Parisian department store.

item.title: The justice system is failing - the buck stops with Lammy
item.description: [BBC News] Problems in the prisons and the courts are not new but they are growing and the government doesn't have a grip on them.

item.title: Inside Gaza, BBC sees total devastation after two years of war
item.description: [BBC News] With endless rubble and destroyed streets as far as the eye can see, any plans for Gaza's future are a far cry from where it is today, writes Lucy Williamson.

item.title: What a UK government led by Reform would really look like
item.description: [BBC News] What the party's first six months at the helm at local level shows about how they govern - and whether they can keep their promises

item.title: Inspektor Pentagona tvrdi da je ministar odbrane ugrozio vojnu akciju korišćenjem mobilne aplikacije
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Telo koje nadzire rad Pentagona utvrdilo je da je ministar odbrane SAD Pit Hegset doveo američko osoblje i njihovu misiju u opasnost koristeći aplikaciju za razmenu poruka Signal da bi preneo osetljive informacije o vojnom napadu na Hute u Jemenu, rekle su danas dve osobe upoznate sa nalazima.

item.title: Walescast Senedd debate
item.description: [BBC News] The debate comes as parties look ahead to next May's Welsh Parliament election.

item.title: Federalni agenti SAD otpočeli masovna hapšenja migranata po Nju Orleansu
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Američki federalni agenti su danas počeli da obilaze ulice Nju Orleansa u najnovijoj akciji administracije predsednika Donalda Trampa protiv imigranata širom SAD, čiji je cilj da se pohapse migranti optužene za nasilna krivična dela, rekao je jedan zvaničnik Ministarstva unutrašnje bezbednosti.

item.title: Kad i gde možete gledati utakmicu Evrolige Partizan – Bajern?
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Košarkaši Partizana dočekuju ekipu Bajerna u okviru 14. kola Evrolige.

item.title: Advokatska komora Srbije osudila napad na advokate, traži pravilno i hitno postupanje nadležnog tužioca
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Advokatska komora Srbije (AKS) osudila je večeras napad na advokate Luku i Danila Nikolića, navodeći da postupajući javni tužilac Prvog osnovnog javnog tužilaštva nije odredio zadržavanje osumnjičenih izvršilaca, zbog čega od Vrhovnog javnog tužilaštva traži da obezbedi hitno i pravilno postupanje nadležnog tužioca.

item.title: (VIDEO) Sumrak favorita u Premijer ligi Engleske
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Veče iznenađenja u 14. kolu Premijer lige Engleske.

item.title: Australia is banning social media for kids under 16. How will it work?
item.description: [BBC News] The world-first law aims to reduce the risks children face online, but critics fear it may not work.

item.title: Zelensky says Ukraine and US negotiators will meet after Russia visit
item.description: [BBC News] The Ukrainian president says a meeting will be arranged once Trump's team return from Moscow, where they held talks with Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Lib Dems call for farming equivalent of Teach First scheme
item.description: [BBC News] The party warns the country is facing a "lost generation of farmers" with only 5% of farmers in the UK under the age of 35.

item.title: Božo Prelević za Danas: Postoji pravna mogućnost za zaštitu Generalštaba pred američkim pravosuđem, ali se to neće desiti, jer su naša vladajuća institucija kriminalci iz ćacilenda
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Mi smo u zakonitosti došli na nivo Ali Babe i 40 razbojnika, i svedočimo najočiglednijem i najtransparentnijem kršenju svih zakona - sada to nije samo pitanje da li su predstavnici Ministarstva kulture nenajavljeno upali i neovlašćeno pristupili serveru Republičkog zavoda za zaštitu spomenika kulture, nego da li su nešto odneli, ili su nešto ostavili - kaže za Danas advokat Božo Prelević, komentarišući novi skandal vezan za Generalštab.

item.title: Riječka policija podnela prekršajnu prijavu protiv muškarca koji je na antifašističkom skupu nosio zastavu sa petokrakom i jugoslovenskom trobojkom
item.description: [Dnevni list Danas] Riječka policija podnela je danas prekršajnu prijavu protiv muškarca koji je na antifašističkom skupu u Rijeci proteklog vikedna nosio partizansku zastavu sa crvenom zvezdom petokrakom i jugoslovenskom trobojkom, objavio je večeras hrvatski portal Novosti.
